intro: Espeletiopsis cristalinensis, commonly known as the crystalline espeletiopsis, is a rare and unique plant species native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its striking, translucent leaves that resemble glass, a feature that helps it capture and retain moisture in its humid environment. The plant belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic species that thrive in tropical and subtropical regions. Its growth is slow, and it often develops a rosette shape to channel rainwater into its central cup. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and climate change.
